Activity: Arrive at work. Get a coffee and check emails.
Address any urgent user inquiries or follow-up questions received overnight. Respond promptly and provide clear solutions.
Finalize the support channel outline and internal guide based on feedback from @Clinlead-1. Make any necessary revisions to ensure accuracy and clarity.

Start drafting a standard operating procedure (SOP) for handling user inquiries related to the EHR system and influenza data collection. Include guidelines for escalation, troubleshooting, and documentation.
Share the draft SOP with @HIS-1 and @HIS-2 for review and feedback. @HIS-1 and @HIS-2 SOP Feedback
Research best practices for providing timely responses to user inquiries. Look for tips on efficient communication, prioritization, and resource allocation.
Develop a system for tracking response times to user inquiries. Create a spreadsheet or use a feature in the ticketing system to monitor average response times and identify areas for improvement.

Collaborate with @QATEST-1 and @QATEST-2 to test the online help desk portal and ensure its functionality meets the required standards. Incorporate feedback on usability and performance. @QATEST-1, @QATEST-2 Help Desk Testing
Create training materials for users on how to use the support channels and access the knowledge base. This could include videos, tutorials, or webinars.
Review the day's progress, organize notes, and plan for tomorrow's tasks. Briefly check favorite blogs.
